channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #143 - Perl-Operated Boy
item.description:
Along the song by Psyche Corporation there are also four Perl 6-related articles this week. Including a game.

The Dutch Perl Workshop is this Friday! Don't miss it!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description:
We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Apply Online here.

item.title: We are Hiring an ETL Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description:
We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Apply Online here.

item.title: Is a strong caution about Heartbleed worth the disruption to distributions with a declared dependency on Crypt::SSLeay?
item.description: Sinan Unur has been quite busy discussing the fallout from the Heartbleed OpenSSL bug and how it relates to Perl.

item.title: Does your code really depend on Crypt::SSLeay?
Introducing fsql and chart
item.description: Two command-line utilities to help you slice/dice and visualize data from CSV files on the console.

item.title: I still hate email
item.description: Not exactly Perl, but if you are into sending e-mails, then you might want to read this from Ricardo Signes.

item.title: CPANdeps pass/fail display now working again
item.description: CPANdeps lets you see the test results of all the dependencies of a given module in a single page.

item.title: Sending email in Perl
item.description: It's funny to see a web-site titled 'PHP Developer' publishing articles on how to do things in Perl. This one is using Email::Sender::Simple and Email::Simple to send an e-mail.

item.title: Learning the Perl Debugger: Lesson 3
item.description: In this part we see the use of s - step in, n - step over, r - step out, and c - continue running.

item.title: Passing arguments
item.description: Sebastian Willing compares 8 different ways for passing arguments to a function checking their speed.

item.title: Codecube.io Now Supports Perl
item.description: Codecube.io is another web site that allows you to run arbitrary code via the web page. Now, thanks to Eric Johnson, it also supports Perl.

item.title: Adopting DateTime::Format::Mail
item.description: More than 10 years after Iain Truskett, the original author of this module has passed away, and after it changed hands several time, BooK (aka. Philippe Bruhat) adopts the module. - The little we can do to preserve the memory of the people who have contributed to the Perl world.

item.title: Release often
item.description: Maybe releasing a CPAN module every day is crazy, but Neil Bowers puts his hand on something that is extremely difficult to do and very valuable: persistence. He has decided to release a new version of a CPAN module every day, but he also offers a bunch of less involved tasks that us, mere mortals, can stick to. So if you'd like to reach something just make sure you make a step every day. An alternative to this idea came from Eric Johnson recommending to write code every day.

item.title: Maintainer's Notes on rt.cpan.org
item.description: Did you know, that you, as a CPAN author, can put a banner text on the top of the RT pages of your modules? That can be a very good way to tell users of your code how, and where to submit bug reports.

item.title: Perl-Operated Boy (full song) by Psyche Corp.
item.description: Filk/parody of Coin-Operated Boy by Dresden Dolls. Lyrics included! Psyche Corporation

item.title: Strawberry Perl 5.18.2.2 released
item.description: Updated external libraries - especially openssl-1.0.1g with a fix for heartbleed bug. Updated perl modules

item.title: Week 15: Performance Work continued
item.description: The Perl 6 weekly

item.title: Racing to writeness to wrongness leads
item.description: Jonathan Worthington writes about C# and how he implemented threading in Perl 6 running on top of the JVM. It isn't easy to read, but as usual it is filled with sentences like this one: 'If anything, we want such inevitably unreliable programs to reliably fail, not reliably pretend to work.'

item.title: New Perl6 game: RetroRacer
item.description: Tadeusz Sosnierz has written a car-racing game in Perl 6. Has the speed of Perl 6 improved so much that you can already play racing games?

item.title: How to run a Perl script automatically every N hours
item.description: Quick example using cron.

item.title: How does the world wide web work?
item.description: A building block for a series of articles about web development using Perl. This one provides some background.

item.title: Perl-related events
item.description: In the following cities: Utrecht (NL), Silver Spring, (MD/USA), Poznan (PL), Prague (CZ), Oslo (NO), Paris (FR), Kiev (UA), Orlando (FL/USA), Sofia (BG), FlÃ¶rli Olten (CH)
